text: in coral rainy winter days what else can
beat a steaming hot desert especially
when it comes from a grill remember the
old days riding my bike back home from
school every time I pass by this Chris
Avenger I just simply could not ignore
the aroma of the burning charcoal
toasting the banana leaves and under
that banana leaf layer is a crispy
golden crust of grilled secure ice what
even more irresistible is a soft
delicate banana in the center waiting
for you to bite in this is definitely
one of my favorite childhood desserts is
called jewbot rib new or grilled banana
wrapped in sticky rice but this amazing
dessert is still incomplete until you
drizzle some coconut sauce and sprinkle
some crushed roasted peanuts and sesame
seeds on top I'm sure you will totally
fall in love with its flavor and
textures from the full time of tasting
so today I will show you how to make it
at home let's begin the ingredients
you're gonna need for Asian work bananas
they are thick and short bananas
whipping and golden skin now peel off
the skin and place the banana in a bowl
and then toss with about a tablespoon of
sugar then put it in the fridge for
about half an hour for the sticky rice
wash where a few times until the water
runs clear and then soak in water for
about one hour then drain well and toss
with a pinch of salt I prefer using
Vietnamese sticky rice which had short
and ground green and they are more
sticky than the Thai sticky rice then
cook the sticky rice in a rice cooker
together with a quarter cup of coconut
milk 1/4 cup of water as you can see the
liquid amount just barely cover the rice
and one or two pandan leaves which I
tied into a knot the pending Lee is
gonna give the rice of really nice
fragrance then press the cook button
when it's done add a tablespoon of sugar
and fluff well
one is too hot Jonesville 1/4 of the
stick your eyes onto a cutting
board use a rice ladle to need the cup
sticky rice until they turn quite mushy
when you break the rice grains is will
become even more sticky then transfer it
onto your foot plastic wrap roll it flat
into the thickness of around 5
centimeter or 1/5 of an inch
you shouldn't grow thinner than that
then place a banana in the center and
wrap it up shape it nicely and twist the
excess plastic wrap so the sticky rice
will stick and hold the banana tight if
you would like you can also add some
shredded young coconut into the sticky
rice when leading it will add some nice
texture to the coating
now remove the plastic wrap and use a
smaller piece of banana leaf to wrap the
banana first lengthwise and then use the
other to wrap around it then place the
rose on the stove to grill it's best if
you can use jackhole stove if not using
infrared stove like I do is completely
fine you can also grill in the oven at
250 degree sensors for about 20 to 30
minutes or until they are golden brown
this would not work with induction stove
though when the banana layer is quite
charged it smell really amazing and the
sticky rice that you're gonna firms up
and turn golden brown so appetizing for
the coconut sauce you will need 1 cup of
coconut milk a teaspoon sugar a pinch of
salt and 1/2 a teaspoon of tapioca or
corn starch to thicken it store really
well before you turn on the stove and
bring it to a boil you can also tie a
few pending leaves and throw into the
coconut sauce to give it a nice aroma
when the sticky rice layer is nicely
Jordan
you can remove the banana leaf and then
cut into your bite-sized pieces then
drizzle the delicious and rich coconut
sauce over the top and don't forget to
sprinkle some crushed roasted peanuts
and sesame - it looks so good and I
really cannot wait when you have a bites
you can feel the glutinous of the sticky
rice the soft and sweet of the banana
the crispy and fragrance of the peanuts
and sesame and the richness of the
coconut milk will bring everything
together it just couldn't be any better
if you liked the recipe don't forget to
